speaker: Bill Richardson
vclaim: "New Mexico was 46 in the teacher's salary (when he was elected), now we're 29."
date: stated on May 10, 2007 in a TV ad.:
title: Yeah, but the statistics came from a friend group.
text: Richardson has led a successful effort to raise teachers ' wages, but we cannot give him a very honest judgement because he fails to mention that he mixes ranks with two sources. The ranking of 46 is derived from the survey conducted by the National Association of Education in 2002-2003 on teachers ' wages. The most recent arrangement for the National Energy Agency, with statistics for 2004-2005, only shows that New Mexico has risen to 40. The New Mexico chapter of the National Energy Agency made its own assessment and concluded that the state is now ranked 29th in the teacher ' s salary, but the local National Energy Agency branch is run by Charles Bauer, who defines himself as a long-time supporter of Richardson. On January 13, 2021, the distinguished fact-finding bloggers announced in a story in which General David H. Berger, commander of the United States Navy, rejected Nancy Belusi's request for the use of marines for inaugural security, saying, "We are not working for you."
